p.s: In the given excerpts Gatsby wants to revive his past relationship with Daisy.
As we can see, the embarassmentembarrassment changes to joy, which is a good first sign, especially of Daisy, as she is the pursued person.
Even thoughtthough they haven't met each other for five years, it seems like they still get along well and are building up the good chemistry that they probably had.

Nick mentions that he has the impression that Daisy doesn't fullfillfulfill Gatsby's expetationsexpectations regarding her, but this aspect doesn't seem to dull his joy, since he's still in love with her.
From Daisy's past we get the information that she probably still has feelings for him, because she has serious doubts before marrying Tom, crying over a letter of Gatsby.
This leads to the assumptions that both figures have feelings for each other.
The main aspects that interrupting the simple revival of their relationship are Tom Buchanan and her daughter.
Because of them, she can't just live a life with Gatsby, especially because a divorce wasn't well looked at in society.
Additionally, Tom Buchanan, that we got to know as unfriendly and brutal probably wouldn't let his wife go, even if he himself has an affair, which would also be an option for Daisy (with Gatsby).
In general many people have similar circumstances.
They already are in a relationship, have children or have other things that they can't leave easily behind.
Furthermore the majority of people change in a long or short amount of time which could mean that getting along or revive old feelings, if they are still there, is difficult.
Another option is, that while one person still has feelings, the other person doesn't.
Because of that one could say that a revival in general isn't very likely, while the relationship in the novel might has a good chance despite Daisy's marriage.
